channel.title: Build :: DevDocs Navigation Menu Test
channel.description: Build Click here to give feedback about this page Section Notes The Build section targets developers looking for ways to integrate Okta with their applications. Each doc focuses on a specific use case or set of best practices. This section’s content is in usage order. That is, the first guides listed in the navigation are those developers are most likely to use first (Adding an authentication solution to an app) when building an application to those needed last (Reporting and Monitoring).

item.title: Get started
item.description: Get started Click here to give feedback about this page Section Notes The Get Started section presents the most common tasks a developer will need to know how to do as they develop solutions integrated with Okta. It also gives the new developer an opportunity to get some samples up and running. About This Page Page ID: 12 Is this a new page?: Completely new doc with new content Target personas: Internal app builders, Saas Builder

item.title: Sign in
item.description: Authenticate Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 24 Is this a new page?: Completely new doc with new content Target personas: Internal app builders, Saas Builder Description: Simple guide hub with a summary paragraph and links to the various guides in the section. Describe authentication options available. Set up user journeys. Currently splitting authentication by functionality. We can either lead the split by functionality or by product.

item.title: Deploy
item.description: Deploy your sign-in solution Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 67 Is this a new page?: Completely new doc with new content Target personas: Internal app builders, Saas Builder Description: This section only talks about deploying an app. When there are so many deployment strategies these days, this section seems woefully inadequate. Changes to be made: Changes for beyond phase 1: Per @Brian Duffield: Existing “Deploy to Production” content needs to be thoroughly reviewed; Understand better whether we need to add more content here or understand this section’s role better.

item.title: Migrate users
item.description: Migrate your users to Okta Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 35 Is this a new page?: Completely new doc with new content Target personas: Internal app builders, Saas Builder Description: Is this section still relevant considering all the new user migration strategies these days. Changes to be made: Changes for beyond phase 1: Per @Brian Duffield, the “Migrate to Okta” content is very stale and needs a thorough review.

item.title: Upgrade
item.description: Upgrade Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 299 Is this a new page?: Completely new doc with new content Target personas: Internal app builders, Saas Builder Changes to be made: Changes have been made to this section but they are minimized for now because: Lack of user research on specifically how customers are working with the current upgrade docs The docs are already isolated into one section on the site and seem fairly organized, although, they would need to be analyzed from a user journey perspective in the future An educated guess would be that Upgrade docs are not used as much by customers when compared to other docs such as Authentication (We need to confirm this) Links to original docs:
